content.text: Get to Lumbridge, continue Cold War, complete RFD/Evil Dave, start RFD/Awowogei, RFD/Sir Amik Varze (speak with the cook to learn the recip
e)
, RFD/Lumbridge Guide and RFD/Skrach. Buy black
gloves.
Note: do NOT let Larry teleport you to the iceberg! You will be stuck there with no easy way back.

metadata.items_needed: penguin suit, evil stew, air runes, water rune, law rune
metadata.skills_quests_met: yes (listen to the wiki when it tells you to steal a bell and grab items)

content.text: Continue OSF (Misthalin steps), when in Draynor speak with the Wise Old Man for RFD/Varze
then run to the Wizards’ Tower and speak with Wizard Traiborn for RFD/Lumbridge Guide. Run back, continue OSF. W
hen in Port Sarim kill seagulls for Rag and Bone Man II
then
speak with The Face and Felkrash for Ratcatchers (until you need to go to the snake charmer).

metadata.items_needed: cash stack, chicken cages, blunt axe, hellcat, catspeak amulet, snake charm, charos(a), bucket of milk, egg, pot of flour, cake tin

content.text: Complete One Small Favour (charter to Brimhaven into the cart to Shilo Village, then leave the city, lamps on
slayer
). Complete Cold War. Complete Making History (teleport around a bit).
If you don’t have a spare purple dye, pick one up while in Ardougne for Making History.

metadata.items_needed: cash stack, ring of charos(a), sharpened axe, penguin suit, swamp tar, 5 feathers, mission report, mahogany plank, soft leather, cowbell (stolen in Step 57), swordfish, melee gear, prayer potions, spade, Ectophial, ghostspeak amulet, sapphire amulet, Fremennik boots 1, necklace of passage, law runes, water staff, enchanted key, dueling ring (to get to Castle Wars for the first step in Making History, but also rebank at Ferox), air runes, earth rune

content.text: Go to f
airy ring BIQ, enter the Kalphite hive and collect 5 potato cacti for the diary, then return to the Shantay pass and collect the easy Desert diary (lamp on
Slayer
). Bank, grab your cat
and quest items. Run/carpet to
Pollnivneach and continue Ratcatchers.
On any herb run complete Ratcatchers in Port Sarim
, entering the rat pits for the diary.

metadata.items_needed: Ardy Cloak 1, dramen staff, energy pots, rope, waterskins, Camulet, hellcat, catspeak amulet

content.text: After this step, continue and complete Between a Rock…, smithing the gold helmet in the Wilderness resource arena. While in the wilderness for that step run to the Demonic Ruins and restore a prayer point for the diary, then run to the Fountain of Rune to cast low alchemy on any junk (explorer’s ring alch works on any spellbook). Alch the rune pickaxe that you get as a reward
at some point.

metadata.items_needed: cash stack (only take 7.5k into Wildy), 3 gold bars, slash item/weapon, hammer, pickaxe (for Wildy med diary, so addy instead of rune for example), melee gear, prayer pots, swordfish

content.text: MLM for coal and gem bag (repair the strut along the way for the diary). Do low level
group
Volcanic Mine (this is a bit of a trek) for the prospector hat, and optionally for the rest of the gear as well. Check out
https://discord.gg/FXPUrUp
for finding teams.
Complete the Falador hard diary step. Complete the Falador easy diary, putting the lamp on slayer.
At MLM after hourlies you can run back from the Falador patch after a herb run, or use the Arceuus Spawn Point teleport to get back to Falador.
Similar to the barbarian fishing you can choose to spread this out over multiple steps, although this time you need at least 72 mining by step 64
and you need to have completed MLM by step 73.

If you think the coal and gem bag are not useful enough you can instead opt to first get ~68-70 mining through other means (in particular, sandstone or blast mining). This option will mean you will be short on gp and have to make a set of air staves from scratch to adjust.
There is a tick manipulation method to significantly increase the speed of Motherload Mine (credit to Port Khazard and Drøgøn for discovering this). You can find a short example clip of this here:
https://imgur.com/a/UkY7Ytj
(the clip has a metronome sound for timing). The method works as follows:
You need an
adamant
pickaxe, other tiers don’t work.
The method, explained below in more detail, works the same way you would 3t mine (e.g. 3s1g, or granite) but
on a successful mine, click the next ore again on the xp drop, so that the total cycle is 4t
on a success and 3t on a failure. Note that ‘click’ here means ‘click processed on this tick’, so you have to give the input 1t earlier.
tick 1: herb tar rock 1t away
tick 2: interact
tick 3: still interacting
tick 4: herb tar rock 1t away (does nothing if succeeded) - this is the tick 1 of the next cycle if you failed
tick 5: click same rock u did in tick 4 (incase you succeeded) - this is the tick 1 of the next cycle if you succeeded
Theoretically this represents an increase of approximately 40% in xp/hr at level 70 mining, though realistically the gains will be lower due to having to move to a new spot more often.
OSRSMLMMotherlodeMineSpot.png

shows a recommended location (in the southwest corner) for having multiple veins close to one another. Alternatively you can pick a closer spot to the deposit chute but have to adapt more to veins depleting.
3t/4t (3.5t?) double roll motherlode mine example
shows the method in full, with an explanation in the description of the video.
Tick manip Motherlode Mine example
shows a non-optimised example clip, slightly north of the recommended spot.

Your ~11 days of Misc should be more than over by now (they probably were a long time ago), make sure to take out the remaining GP (fill up the cash stack to at least 200k total) if you haven’t already even if the time hasn’t passed.
Start Swan Song, continue Eagles’ Peak until you need to report back to
Charlie
(last step). Visit the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village
. V
isit
Charlie
to complete Eagles’ Peak, use a necklace of passage to Eagles Eyrie and take multiple eagle rides (back and forth to each location, finishing in the
desert
) to progress three diaries.
Run to the Shantay Pass to collect the Desert medium diary reward and put the lamp on Slayer. Take the fairy ring to the Piscatoris hunter area (AKQ),
optional: when in the Piscatoris region box trap a ferret and then rabbit snare + ferret to catch a rabbit for a rabbit’s foot, then string it for extra eggs on future bird runs,
r
un to Piscatoris and continue Swan Song. Complete Swan Song.
Start and complete Making Friends with My Arm, boosting your agility level with an agility potion if necessary.
Good herb runs start here.

Make the Fire of Nourishment (three Fires of Eternal Light optional), grab an iron pickaxe, mine all the basalt (using your rune pickaxe) and salts for all the fires, make 100 Stony basalt and 100 Icy basalt. In total this requires 200 basalt, 1050 Efh, 1000 Urt and 1300 Te salt.
Optional: also make the Fire of Dehumidification and the Fire of Unseasonal Warmth +(350 Efh, 150 Te and 400 Urt salt).

metadata.items_needed: cash stack, 10 mist runes, 10 lava runes, 5 blood runes, airtight pot, rune pickaxe, rune axe, tinderbox, hammer, ring of charos(a), dramen staff, Ardy Cloak 1, melee gear, prayer pots, swordfish, yellow dye, swamp tar, necklace of passage, rope, energy pots, teasing stick, box trap, rabbit snare, law runes, soul runes

content.text: Do barbarian fishing
to 99 fishing at CoX (buy as many feathers as needed), make sure to do Barblore as much as possible. Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking for RFD/Awowogei.
NOTE: if you are not aiming to max in the future you can skip this step, and instead train agility to level 72 manually (at Seers rooftops).
You can get to the fishing spot by using the Arceuus Library teleport (the Arceuus spell, not the Kharedst’s) into the minecart to get back. This is faster than the Kharedst’s to Lovakengj.
Example setup here
- the gp predates the Zeah favour rework and is not necessary.
Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking later.
If you decide not to, then you’ll have to do Mess Hall, which is slower.
For an explanation on the Mount Quidamortem barblore (can be afked, just bank the sturgeons), see
20230127LowLevelBarblore
. Warning: this document is several years out of date, and just covers the basic idea.
When you hit 66 herblore make a super defence potion in the Fremennik province for the Fremennik hard diary.

Maintain hourlies (contracts, bird runs, hardwood and fruit tree runs, herb runs, optionally seaweed - you will never need more than 12.5k seaweed). You can stop growing cats if you want though it’s still good to continue, after all you’re fishing for cat food nonstop.
Optional alternative: use the firefighter method
Tempoross - 80+ Permits/Hour - Solo Firefight Method
at Tempoross for high points/hr to get a fishing barrel, then resume the barbarian fishing grind.

metadata.items_needed: knife, teak log, barbarian rod, feathers, 2-dose potions

content.text: Swap to the regular spellbook. Complete Recipe for Disaster by following the steps below:
GP stack:
Dueling ring to Al Kharid, take the gnome glider to the Feldip Hills. Speak with Rantz to progress RFD/Skrach until you are asked to meet him in Karamja.

(redirected) POH tab to Brimhaven, take the travel cart to Shilo village. Resume Legends’ Quest all the way to the final step (have obtained the totem pole). While in the jungle chop a teak and mahogany log, collect a palm leaf (chop a palm tree) five times (drop and pick up), make and eat an oomlie wrap (kill an oomlie for food, use palm leaf, cook and eat), collect a vanilla pod along the way for RFD/Sir Amik Varze and kill a deathwing inside the Viyeldi caves for the diary. Head to the northwest of Tai Bwo Wannai village and light a fire on the coast for RFD/Skrach, take the boat back to Rantz and prepare a cooked jubbly.

Ardougne Cloak into a fairy ring to the Legends’ Guild (BLR), go inside and complete the quest, putting the lamps on herblore. Go back outside, take the fairy ring to Zanaris. Grind a sweetcorn into flour if you haven’t yet, then go into the Evil Chicken’s Lair and resume RFD/Varze until you have the brulee.
Take the fairy ring CLR to Ape Atoll, do all of RFD/Awowogei up to and including the step where you have the cooked stuffed snake.
Teleport to Lumbridge. Complete RFD (including the Culinaromancer fight), lamping Herblore. Buy barrows gloves.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: If you cannot yet enter the Warriors’ Guild (130 combined attack and strength), train your attack/strength with slayer tasks until you can (your goal is 60 atk 70 str). Enter the Warriors’ Guild, kill cyclopes to get a dragon defender (bank some black knives along the way). Your attack and defence should both be at least level 60, if they are not train attack to 60 first, then defence to 60. After this train defence as high as it will go during the defender grind.
If you do not get to level 60 defence from the dragon defender grind, train your defence to 60 with slayer tasks or sand crabs.
Cheese potatoes are a reasonable food source for many situations (though worse than 15-healing premade gnome food). Buy 1000 of either of them. You may mix and match.
Buy a defence potion.
If you haven’t already, go to either the PVP Arena or to NMZ and imbue your berserker ring and salve amulet.

The PVP Arena method involves either an alt/friend to boost points (go at off-peak hours, hope to get matched with each other, quickly die to the other/kill the other for points, repeat) or just suiciding to randoms for quick points
imbue scroll via pvp arena - losing method
For a guide on NMZ, see
OSRSNMZGuide.txt
or
I figured out how Nightmare Zone points are calculated. New meta for AFKing with absorption pots to get good XP/hr and decent points/hr! : r/2007scape
. Briefly, there are four main methods:
Afk easy rumble: pick 5 high xp bosses, afk in easy rumble with absorption potions. 20 minute afk, medium xp, almost no points.

Afk hard rumble: pick 5 high xp bosses, rock cake down to 1hp, absorption potions. ~8 minute afk (after that point your 1k charges are out and you have to cake back down and refill your absorptions), high xp, medium points.
Hybrid hard rumble: following the reddit link, pick a mixture of bosses that give good points and are afk, then copy the method for afk hard rumble. ~8 minute afk, medium xp, good points.
Active (‘points’) nmz: only disable the bosses in the list below. fight them actively. When annoying bosses pop up, ignore them until you roll ultimate power. Not afk, high xp, very high points.
Corrupted Lizardman
Elvarg
Dad
Glod
The Recipe for Disaster bosses
Giant Roc
Barrelchest
Elven traitor
Essyllt
Corsair Traitor
Go to NMZ and collect enough points (using the above guide) for redirection scrolls. From here on you have redirected POH tabs for herb runs, tree runs and general use.

metadata.items_needed: cash stack, cut diamond, melee gear (now incl. dscim/DDS), mithril armour set, prayer potions, stat-boosting potions, cheese potatoes (buy in guild)

content.text: Tackle organised crime for intelligence along the way and hand it in at Captain Ginea for the diary. Catch a chinchompa in the Kourend Woodland. Collect T5 Shayzien outfit from the combat ring. Collect the medium Kourend & Kebos diary. Put the XP lamps on slayer. Do A Kingdom Divided (need to be on the normal spellbook, lamps on Slayer), using melee for the fights. Grab the skull near the Shayzien graveyard dungeon entrance and buy redberries in Kenelme’s Wares (Piscarilius) along the way. Minigame teleport to Mort’ton, start and complete His Faithful Servants miniquest, which includes doing a complete barrows run (all six brothers). It is recommended to complete the
Defence? What Defence?
Can't Touch Me
Pray for Success
and optionally also
Just Like That
tasks on this run, dds speccing Karil (and hoping for good hits or resetting on a failure), maging the four melee brothers and meleeing Ahrim.

metadata.items_needed: melee gear, cheese potatoes, stat-boosting potions, prayer potions, a defence potion (3 dose), volcanic sulphur, molten glass, dark essence block, an axe, fire bolt runes

content.text: Kill green dragons with defensive melee and thralls until you reach level 65 defence. Do King’s Ransom (XP on herblore), then the Knight Waves Training Grounds. Set your spawn point to Camelot. Use the bones at the Chaos Altar to get to 60+ prayer.  Return to the green dragons, killing 1.3k total with defensive melee (to 70 defence, swap to accurate, i.e. attack training, after) banking both bones and hides using a looting bag. Along the way kill one mammoth and an ent, chopping some yew logs from the ent for the diary.

The standard setup (with or without dragonfire potions) is: Helm of Neitiznot (risked), Dragon Scimitar, Dragon Defender, Amulet of Strength, Barrows gloves (+1), Proselyte top + bottom, Berserker Ring (i), Ardougne Cloak 1, Climbing Boots, Rada’s Blessing 1, Resurrect Superior Skeletal/Ghostly thrall runes (unless you have access to the Greater spell at level 76, boostable from 73 with a Wizard’s Mind Bomb. If so, use that instead) and book. Use a games necklace to Corporeal Beast then run east to get to the dragons (1250 or 1500 total level worlds are usually empty), and dueling rings back to Ferox to bank and restore.
The
example setup looks like this
, although you may not need as much food.

The best strategy for completing the Knight Wave Training Grounds is not flinching or poison, but simply fighting them using food and potions and letting the knights kill you once you run low on supplies. This will let you continue at the knight that killed you, making it very easy. The minigame is safe so HCIM can use this method too.
This will get your defence to 70 (and, once you use the bones on the Chaos Altar, also prayer to 70), unlocking Piety.

At some point your stats are high enough you might be within reach of completing the easy tier of the Combat Achievements, giving you a quick 5k xp lamp for a skill of your choice (probably herblore).

HCIM: you can opt to train through calcified rocks in Varlamore instead, offering blessed bone shards at the liberation bowl. Note that this scales with your mining level, so optionally you could choose to do more mining (sandstone, granite or gem rocks) first.

metadata.items_needed: melee gear (as mentioned), looting bag, cheese potatoes, stat-boosting pots, runes for thralls

content.text: Cash in the prayer xp at the Chaos Altar when convenient (use the suicide method at off-peak hours in random worlds recommended). If you have spare red topazes you can make burning amulets.
After one of your inventories, run into the King Black Dragon Lair for the diary.Tele out to Ferox using a dueling ring or suicide.
Pest control minigame teleport, do a novice and intermediate game of Pest Control.
If you have enough fossils for three display cases and also completed Curse of the Empty Lord:

Teleport to Varrock, pray at the altar in the palace with smite active. Build three fossil display cases and speak with the information clerk for xp, with historian Minas for an xp lamp and Orlando Smith for the diary. Collect the Varrock hard diary reward, putting the lamp on herblore.
If you do not have enough fossils for two display cases postpone this to step 72.

metadata.items_needed: 1.4k bones, melee gear (for PC)

content.text: Tan your green dragonhides into green dragon leather in Canifis. Make a green d’hide shield. Craft all remaining hides into green d’hide bodies. Alch the bodies (buying nature runes as necessary), e.g. during artefacts, underwater or afk. C

ut your maple logs into arrow shafts (more artefacts), turning one into a maple shortbow for the diary while bankstanding at Seers. Also make a superantipoison potion there. Buy feathers (if you don’t have plenty of those already from bird runs) to get to level 60 and make all into headless arrows, ideally while afking underwater to get more seaweed spores.
Skills/quests met?:

metadata.items_needed: green dragonhides, coins, nature runes, staff of fire, maple logs, knife, steel nails, feathers, Kharedst’s memoirs, log basket

content.text: You should be level 51 (or higher) slayer. Make sure you have finished the Curse of the Empty Lord miniquest (if you haven’t, do it now, putting the lamp on slayer). Teleport to Varrock, make sure to grab the Dragon’hai history book from the Varrock Palace library if you don’t already have it, pray at the altar in the palace with smite active. Run east to the quatzel to go to Varlamore and do Twilight’s Promise, Meat and Greet and At First Light (note: the hunter rumours are currently not efficient, but if you want the rewards you can go for them at any time after this quest). During At First Light catch a Sunlight antelope (east end of the island, requires level 72 hunter, a teasing stick, knife and logs - grab a Trapper’s tipple or two at the hunter’s guild for a +2 boost if needed) and kill a jaguar for their fur. At the hunter’s guild buy two mixed hide bases, and either pay Pellem to have the furs made into mixed hide boots (your best ranged boots for now) and a mixed hide cape (your best melee cape for now) or boost your crafting level if you have a spare mushroom pie to do it yourself. After this start and complete Perilous Moons (for the fights your dragon scimitar is fine, even for ice. Use the moss lizards and moonlight potions for supplies) and The Heart of Darkness. Slay a Brine rat to complete the Fremennik medium diary, putting the lamp on herblore. Grab a rope, salve teleport, dip your enchanted silvthrill rod in the well to make the Rod of Ivandis and complete In Aid of the Myreque, Darkness of Hallowvale, A Taste of Hope and Sins of the Father (all lamps on herblore). Use the Efaritay’s aid during the Vanstrom Klause fight in Sins of the Father - you should only need one ring, the second is spare in case you die or run out of charges.

We will continue lamping slayer to level 58 for access to Cave Horrors, and after that put all lamps on herblore instead. You may choose to lamp more/less slayer depending on personal preference. There is more than enough lamp xp.
This unlocks Yarnio’s Baked Goods shop, a slightly better shop location for Garden pies than Romily Weaklax.

You can now complete the Varrock hard diary, if you haven’t before already., Teleport to Varrock and speak with the information clerk for xp, historian Minas for the Curse of the Empty Lord xp lamp and Orlando Smith for the diary. Put the lamps on slayer or herblore as mentioned previously.

metadata.items_needed: law runes, soul runes, silvthrill rod, rope, dramen staff, plank, 8 nails, hammer

content.text: Catch ~1.5k grey chins for level 55 ranging (at Soul Wars - you can take an axe to chop the nearby teaks in case you mess up your knife-log). Catch
~1.5k red chins
in the Feldip Hills. Train your ranging in the MM1 tunnels (short fuse) to level 62 (55 with grey, 55-62 with red). Make sure to equip a salve amulet (ei)
(glory is better if you have it)
Optional alternative: skip this step and AFK the range training at crabs, you can even go to 70 but it is not really worth going beyond that.

Second optional alternative: after getting 50 ranging with either method, do A Night at the Theatre to lamp Ranging four times (80k xp total), then use either method to train to level 62 after. You will probably need someone to carry you for A Night at the Theatre, but this is going to be true even if you go at some later point.
If you have the herblore level to make ranged pots go and teleport one inventory of zamorak wines and make them all into potions, repotting frequently while chinning.
Buy an upgraded device from Ava at level 50 (worth leaving for).
At level 60 you can equip your mixed hide boots.
Osrs 1 Def Pure Chinning guide and Experience rates
and
OSRS Pure Chinning Guide (Maximizing XP rates)
show the mm1 tunnel method, though it is better to use a spot one curve deeper into the cave. The best location is shown (poorly) in
this image

Optional: go do the Fight Caves for a fire cape. It will take quite a long time to get one, so we recommend getting one on step 27 of Chapter 3 instead. But if you feel confident and want one soon, this is the best moment.
You will be doing floor 3 runs until 82 agility. Along the way you want to loot certain coffins for hallowed marks and generic loot. It is optional but
recommended
to continue all the way to 98 agility instead. The following coffins are recommended:
On floor 3, loot the enchantment obstacle (only on the
ONE
side,
20240224_F3_Enchant_West.png

, so on 50% of all runs). With a Hallowed focus (costs 100 hallowed marks) you will never fail the enchant and it will default to the lowest level enchantment spell you have on you. Without one the fail rate depends on the level of the spell and it will default to the highest one you have on you. It is recommended to use lvl-5 enchant before you have the focus, and lvl-3 enchant after. The XP gained for each spell is the same, regardless of level.
On floor 3 each side has a grapple (
20240224_F3_Grapple_West.png
20240224_F3_Grapple_East.png

). You may choose to loot these right from the start, but failing them loses a lot of time. If you collect the Hallowed grapple (costs 100 hallowed marks) it is optional but not recommended to loot these until level 82 to speed up getting other loot.
Floors 1-2 are not worth looting, although if you are chasing collection log slots you have to loot these too.
20240224_F2_Grapple_West.png
for floor 2 and see below for floor 1.

If you are using mahogany planks with rune nails (in BRUHsailer you will not be doing this) to build bridges it is efficient construction xp to build the bridge in floor 1 (on two out of four sides, so on 50% of all runs,
20240224_F1_Bridge_Coffin_West.png
) but not to cross it. Alternatively this is required if you are hunting the collection log slots.

Based on the above, the recommended order for purchasing the Hallowed items is Focus > Instances > Ring > Hammer > Grapple. If you have banked vampyre ashes it is worth buying the Hallowed symbol and using them on floor 4 only. It is not efficient to collect vampyre ashes. You may always buy a few Hallowed tokens in case of a terrible run, so that you may finish it in time (and buy new tokens after).
You will be doing Fletchp
alch

re (fletching headless arrows and casting high alchemy while moving at sepulchre). Feel free to bring the herb sack and plank sack. Maintain hourlies. It is also possible to blow glass inside the sepulchre, this is even more efficient than other multiskilling options. Most of the time is spent alching, not fletching.

Once you have a little bit of cash restart misc to get teak logs for planks for building bridges (2400 total, 8 days). 10 teak 5 herb(/other) at Misc, along with 10 mahog 5 herb(/other) for future bird runs if you run low/out. Keep in mind that changing the Miscellania allocation works retroactively.

Keep misc running even if you have enough planks for Sepulchre. Once you have enough planks, swap to 10 mahogany 5 herb(/other) for future construction training. As your cash stack grows just dump 7.5m in there (we will assume this going forward).
You will only need these teak planks by the time you hit 82 agility, not before then.
After Misc is up and running, buy arrow shafts and headless feathers (in smaller chunks) to get to a total of 1 million headless arrows through fletchpalchre.
Alch (all) rune bolts for good magic xp along the way.
We recommend buying the initial helpful items first and then spending all further hallowed marks on hallowed crystal shards (the teleports) or saving them in case of a buff/change to the shop.
If you want a change of pace you can afk mine daeyalt essence for runecrafting later. There is also a high effort daeyalt (“dae-alch”) method:
https://streamable.com/it7kry
You can do this grind in smaller parts, or quit entirely at a lower agility level.
Example setup here.

metadata.items_needed: green/blue d’hides, box traps, knife, teak log, salve amulet(ei), whatever other ranged gear you can scrounge up, crossbow, Sara items, hammer, fire staff, nature runes, a lot of money (obtained during the step, spent during the step).

additionalContent.text: Read this step in its entirety carefully. This step contains the Hallowed Sepulchre grind to level 82 agility.

content.text: Do Blast Mining
https://streamable.com/l3ylry
to get to 330 addy ore total, buying the dynamite from the shop as needed.
Hybrid ore uim smelt (
Hybrid ore UIM smelting
) your mithril from MLM. Smelt your gold ore from MLM. Use the UIM gold method (
Lazy UIM Gold

) to train your smithing to level 70, getting permission from the foreman to use the blast furnace for free at level 60. Turn all your mithril bars into platebodies (Varrock west anvils, make 10 bars into 150 nails, make a mithril 2h sword for Devious Minds and ~5 bars into grapples along the way), then alch them (similar to before). Hybrid ore uim smelt your addy (buy coal as needed) into bars. Use UIM gold to train your smithing to (15,000 xp away from) level 74. Make sure to equip your ring of charos (a) until level 60 for reduced foreman costs.  Start and complete Defender of Varrock (there’s a free 5k xp lamp after the quest at Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum, put it on slayer if you aren’t level 58 yet and herblore otherwise). Make 4950 adamant nails (make sure to save an adamantite bar) with your bars at Varrock west anvils.
Skills/quests met?:
Optional: you can go to level 70-73 only and boost for making the nails instead.

After this create 5 mithril grapples and complete and collect the rewards for the Ardougne medium diary, the Kandarin medium diary, the Lumbridge & Draynor medium diary (all lamps on slayer) and complete the grapple step for the Falador medium diary.
Now that you have a mithril grapple you can do the quests The Curse of Arrav and The Path of Glouphrie. It is recommended to do them now, but you can also leave them for later.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Note: if you are not planning to max you can reduce this step, although the lack of prayer potions might prove to be an issue for slayer later. You will also need to obtain more planks and train construction at your own convenience if you do not go to at least level 96 agility during this step. That being said, 98 agility at Sepulchre is a loooong grind, so give serious consideration to reducing/splitting it.
Read this step in its entirety carefully.
This step contains a huge Hallowed Sepulchre grind.
After level 82 agility you are good for a while, but there is no real reason not to continue at Sepulchre.
It is optional but
recommended
to continue all the way to 98 agility. The following coffins are recommended:
Floor 4 has a bridge (only on
ONE
side,
20240224_F4_Bridge.png
so on 50% of all runs). With a Hallowed hammer you will never break nails while attempting to build this bridge, and it is highly recommended to buy this hammer before reaching level 82 agility.
Floor 4 has an enchantment obstacle  (only on
ONE
side,
20240224_F4_Enchant_and_Bridge.png
so on 50% of all runs). If you have (and continue to be) tick perfect this is
not

worth looting, as it means you will lose the timing for ‘sword skip’ (and the 1:20-1:23 lap time) on the next section. If you are not tick perfect up to this floor the enchantment obstacle is efficient to loot, and works identically to that on floor 3.
Floor 5 always has an enchantment obstacle
20240224_F5_Enchant.png
, a grapple obstacle
20240224_F5_Grapple.png
and a bridge obstacle
20240224_F5_Bridge.png
, followed by a grand coffin
20240224_F5_Grand_Coffin.png
. Every single one of these is efficient to loot.

Floors 1-3 are not worth looting anymore, although if you are chasing collection log slots you have to loot these too. If you are using mahogany planks with rune nails (in BRUHsailer you will not be doing this) to build bridges it is efficient construction xp to build the bridge in floor 1 (on two out of four sides, so on 50% of all runs,
20240224_F1_Bridge_Coffin_West.png
) but not to cross it.
You will be doing
Fletchp
alch

re (fletching headless arrows and casting high alchemy while moving at sepulchre) all the way to 98 agility. Feel free to bring the herb sack and plank sack. Maintain hourlies. It is also possible to blow glass inside the sepulchre, this is even more efficient than other multiskilling options. Most of the time is spent alching, not fletching.
After Misc is up and running, buy arrow shafts and headless feathers (in smaller chunks) to get to a total of 1 million headless arrows through fletchpalchre.
Alch (all) rune bolts for good magic xp along the way.
We recommend buying the initial helpful items first and then spending a lot of hallowed marks on hallowed crystal shards (the teleports). Doing this for levels 82-
will on average grant the following loot and xp:
~24.5m gp (not including the costs for fletching, nature runes, planks etc)
565k thieving xp, 444k construction xp, ~600k fletching xp and 3.2m magic xp (primarily through alchs).
6.1k cosmic runes (these are useful for enchanting bracelets for gp and jewellery for general use later)
8.1k death runes
44.7k law runes (these serve no long term purpose but can be used to fill a nexus, for example)
44.7k blood runes (a good initial stack for barraging during slayer)
44.7k soul runes (these have some uses for Arceuus and barrage spells, as well as being required for Tumeken’s Shadow eventually)
12.7k adamant bolts (next to useless)
1100 monkfish
102 prayer potions (4)
336 sanfew serums (4) (useful at DKS and the nightmare)
152 grimy ranarr weeds
336 ranarr seeds (~2.0k (4)-dose prayer potions when farmed, a good starting supply for slayer)
72 strange lockpicks (for Barrows later, although the meta is to only do a little bit of barrows, using around 5-10 lockpicks)
2.12 Rings of Endurance (88% chance to get at least one)
16.2k hallowed teleport crystals -

this is more teleports than you will likely use for banking on the road of all activities combined to maxing, so instead it is a good idea to partially save the hallowed marks (e.g. for future updates, potentially amylase) or spend it on loot sacks.
If you want a change of pace you can afk mine daeyalt essence for runecrafting later. There is also a high effort daeyalt (“dae-alch”) method:
https://streamable.com/it7kry
You can do this grind in smaller parts, or quit entirely at a lower agility level.
Example setup here.
You can use Parasailer’s Hallowed Sepulchre calculator:
20240115 Hallowed Sepulchre: Looting
to check your loot, xp, material requirements etc. and customise your strategy. A few notes:
This calculator only works for levels 82+, and does not include f1 bridge building for xp. If you wish to build this bridge adjust the number of bridges per run afterwards manually.
The sheet is default set to sell law and soul runes. To fix this go into the ‘High’ tab (bottom left) and uncheck the boxes for selling those runes.
The floor 4 brazier,
20240224_F4_Ash_Coffin.png
, is not recommended as it is not efficient to collect the ash in the first place. If you already have some this is the best use for it though, after buying the hallowed symbol.

metadata.items_needed: crossbow, Sara items, teak planks, addy nails, hammer, fire staff, nature runes, a lot of money (obtained during the step, spent during the step).

sections.title: 2.3: Wait there’s even more quests? And one of them is Song of the Elves?

content.text: At your own convenience make Catherby POH tabs for your herb runs (at the lectern on Lunar Isle). If you have reached level 70 fletching at Sepulchre (or are close enough you are willing to boost for it), teleport to Seers village and complete the Kandarin Hard diary, doing all remaining steps sequentially and putting the lamp on slayer. Remember that the goal is to lamp to 58 slayer, then go back to lamping herblore. Build the following in your POH, boosting when necessary:
Marble lectern
Spirit tree
Teak armour case
Mahogany cape rack
Teak fancy dress box
Mahogany magic wardrobe
Oak toy box
Teak treasure chest
One or two portal rooms (optional) (2 limestone bricks and 9 teak planks per room, plus 100x the teleport runes cost)
The total item requirements for this are: 1 marble block, 1 magic stone, 1 gold leaf, 1 spirit sapling, 19 oak planks, 17 teak planks, 8 mahogany planks.
If you have a fish barrel, move your POH to Brimhaven (move it back after), then buy a few thousand (between 2,000 and 10,000 recommended) raw karambwans using the barrel method in this video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDkz186YgME
. Karambwans are the best food at all levels, and give incredible cooking xp (using a method called ‘1t bwan cooking’). See
OSRSRecklessLadHowDoesFoodWorkV2.png
for information on how food works. Without the barrel, feel free to ignore this.

metadata.items_needed: crystal saw, hammer, items mentioned above

content.text: Do the Mage Arena I miniquest, followed by the Mage Arena II miniquest. Pick your favourite god (Zamorak is slightly more useful than the others for protection in the God Wars Dungeon, but any choice is fine). Along the way/after mine a mithril ore at the Pirates’ Hideout mine and complete a lap of the Wilderness Agility course. Kill Chaos dwarves for a muddy key, open the muddy chest in the centre of the Lava Maze. Kill an ankou at the Forgotten Cemetery, then enter the God Wars Dungeon (god wars protection is necessary!) and kill a bloodveld
Optional: if you want multiple upgraded capes you can kill the bosses of Mage Arena II multiple times to obtain more capes.
The staff is necessary for the wilderness hard diary. After this you can high alch the staff for some gp, if you want.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: (POH) teleport to Rellekka, start The General’s Shadow miniquest. Teleport to Seers and speak with Sin Seer, then teleport to Rellekka and speak with the general again. Make your way to Lunar Isle. Start and complete Dream Mentor (lamp on ranged). Swap to the Lunar spellbook, teleport to Waterbirth, visit Jatizso and mine 5 adamantite ores after this step for two diary steps. POH teleport, make a super defence potion in Rellekka and collect the Fremennik hard diary, putting the lamp on slayer. Swap to Arceuus spellbook. Teleport to Draynor Manor and run out west for a scout for The General’s Shadow.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Do Zogre Flesh Eaters (on Arceuus spellbook, use dueling rings and fairy rings for speeding up the quest), killing Zogres along the way for Rag and Bone Man II. Make sure to unlock Uglug’s Stuffsies. Swap to the normal spellbook for the Slash Bash fight to use Crumble Undead. Make a composite ogre bow (comp ogre bow) and 150 mithril brutal nails, kill 125 chompies for the diary. Speak with Rantz to collect a (handful of) Chompy bird hat(s).
Collect the Western Provinces easy and medium diaries at your own convenience, putting the lamps on slayer.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Teleport to Varrock, take the spirit tree to The Grand Tree. Run south and meet the scout outside the gate for The General’s Shadow. POH tab to Brimhaven, run to The General’s Shadow scout north of Shilo village and progress the miniquest.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Fairy ring to Zanaris, resume and complete Fairytale II - Cure a Queen (xp on slayer). Take fairy ring BIQ to the desert and meet up with the scout for The General’s Shadow.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Teleport (tab) to Rellekka, speak with General Khazard to give him the message and get a severed leg.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Teleport to Lumbridge.

Go into the Dorgeshuun mines and start Land of the Goblins. After being teleported to the goblin caves, finish The General's Shadow, then continue Land of the Goblins and complete it in full (the transportation is awkward, you could swap to the Lunar spellbook but there is no good way to Draynor in that case. There is a crate with an unlimited supply of goblin mails directly east inside the temple, beyond the guards).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Complete the Kourend Medium diary and cash in the reward (lamp on herblore).
Skills/quests met?:

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Kill the following for Rag and Bone Man II, then complete the quest:
Ogres (fairy ring CIQ).
Mogres (fairy ring to AIQ, only spot), complete ‘Skippy and the Mogres’ in full for this.
Optional but recommended: keep killing these to collect flippers for seaweed runs
Basilisks (fairy ring to AJR, only spot).
Trolls (if you didn’t get it along the way during questing).

metadata.items_needed: melee gear, prayer potions, mirror shield, law runes, soul runes, dramen staff, fishing explosives

content.text: Go to Edgeville dungeon, r
un into the wilderness and collect 5 red spider’s eggs (you can drop and pick up the same one five times), cross the handrail and kill an earth warrior. Go back to Edgeville
, speak with the Emblem Trader. Collect the easy and medium wilderness diary rewards, putting the easy lamp on slayer (level 58 without the kandarin hard diary!) and the medium lamp on herblore.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Do Grim Tales. Use the tool leprechaun to withdraw your watering can/seed dibber mid-quest. After the
quest, at some point enter the Falador mines, equip your dwarven helmet for the diary. Alch it after.

metadata.items_needed: 2 vials of water, 2 tarromins, leather gloves, rune axe, cheese potatoes, Iban staff, death runes, fire runes, water runes, air staff, law runes, dueling ring, prayer pots, energy pots

content.text: Do Rum Deal (return with Ectophial), killing a fever spider along the way for the diary. Do Cabin Fever (speak with Bill Teach after the quest for 10
k gp)

and complete a game of trouble brewing (recommended: do the watering buckets only strat to get enough points to buy “the stuff” for future brewing). Do The Great Brain Robbery (put the lamp on Herblore)
, planting watermelons in the allotment patch for the diary along the way.
Complete the Morytania medium d
iary (and easy if you haven’t yet), putting the lamp(s) on Herblore.

metadata.items_needed: Ectophial, melee gear, cheese potatoes, prayer pots, stat-boosting pots, energy pots, fishbowl helmet + diving apparatus, 18 planks, 10 bear fur, hammer, holy symbol, ring of charos(a), bowl, 15 chaos runes, law runes, fire runes, air staff, rune axe, fremennik boots, watermelon seeds, ultracompost, rake, seed dibber

content.text: Make sure you have a runite bar (if
you do not you have three options: 1)
hunt Magpie implings in Puro Puro
; 2) kill Vyrewatch Sentinels for 1/46.5; 3) trade rune platelegs for one at
Nest (nice) - OSRS Wiki
. This third method is recommended
). Do the entire elf quest line
: Regicide, Roving Elves, Mourning’s End Part I, Mourning’s End Part II, Song of the Elves.
Pick the crystal bow reward from Roving Elves. You have all but
one
item on the regular part of the 50 item list for MEPII – you are missing unicorn horn dust (and whiteberries if you didn
’t save any)
Furthermore you need the randomly chosen ticket, book and key (all are easy to obtain).
You may also want a spare hammer and chisel. Also make sure to
farm belladonna(/nightshade) in the Draynor patch to collect at least 8 nightshades for the Seren fight (optional: use explosive liquid from the digsite instead), and also
buy blood+death runes and make
phoenix necklaces.
Check out the quest guides for complicated steps, use ancients + phoenix necklaces and nightshade/belladonna for the Seren fight.
Rock cake and ds2 orb
do work
in the Seren fight, contrary to wiki and other sources. However, activating them is negated when there is a ranged projectile incoming (this is normal behaviour for these items). This means you
can
use them to maintain your hitpoints level, but
cannot
use them to proc the phoenix necklaces during special attacks.
Example clip:
OSRS Song of the Elves boss with phoenix necklaces (no brews)

If you are really struggling with the Seren fight an alternative option is to make several Guthix Rests which don’t delay your next attack when drunk, and also make it very easy to manage your HP during the fight for phoenix necklace procs.
Fragment of Seren written guide
explains the methods for defeating the Fragment of Seren in detail on a low level ironman.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you’ve ever seen

content.text: If you are running low on/out of (redirected) POH tabs collect more soft clay using the gravestone method in the prifddinas mine
Gravestone Double Soft Clay (2400/hr)

. You will have to make soft clay bracelets first. Go to NMZ (optionally as an afk activity) to collect redirection scrolls as necessary. It is recommended to collect a good stack (i.e. 500 tabs and 250 scrolls). Also make Catherby tabs for herb runs.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Optional but recommended: go to the Mage Training Arena and collect the Mage’s book and the infinity boots.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Using your mahogany logs from Miscellania, train construction to level 75 (do not go higher for now). Build the following in your POH, boosting when necessary:
Dark altar
Basic jewellery box
Rejuvenation pool (if you somehow have the staminas)
Mahogany armour case
Mahogany fancy dress box
Gilded cape rack
Gilded portal nexus (optional but not recommended)

The total item requirements for this are: 1 Arceuus signet, 1 bolt of cloth, 1 steel bar, 3 games necklaces(8), 3 rings of dueling(8), 8 marble blocks (for the gilded portal nexus), 3 gold leaves (of which two are for the gilded portal nexus), 1 magic stone, 15 limestone bricks, 5 buckets of water, 6000 soul runes, 5000 blood runes, 1000 body runes, 10 stamina potions(4), 10 prayer potions(4), 11 mahogany planks.

Note: if you want to have a rejuvenation pool (or the likes) in your POH feel free to do some rooftops, for example force spawning (see later in the guide for the best method), for marks of grace to get the required items.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Now that you have daeyalt mining
https://streamable.com/it7kry

unlocked, mine 28k daeyalt essence (you can also just afk mine this). Make 275 binding necklaces, 175 rings of dueling, a fire tiara, buy 28k earth runes (if needed). Swap to the Lunar spellbook. Using magic imbue, your binding necklaces and hallowed crystal shards (teleports) for banking, lava runecraft to level 65.
Complete the Lumbridge Hard diary, putting the lamp on herblore.
Complete the Ardougne Hard diary (also requires a shield left half).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Camp Cave Horrors off-task for a black mask (protect melee allows an amulet of strength, so use your regular slayer gear, proselyte hauberk versus torso is fine either way, use thralls, take your herb sack). Start and complete the Morytania Hard diary (lamp on herblore). Visit Robin twice a day with 13 bones each time to collect 130 ectotokens for bonecrusher charges (3250 charges per day - you will need 24k charges to complete step 10 of this chapter) – collect the bones on any slayer task (for example regular/big/baby dragon). Imbue your black mask at the PVP Arena (
imbue scroll via pvp arena - losing method
) or nightmare zone. An example setup (except for the black mask and expeditious bracelets, obviously) is
cave-horrors.png
. The recommended spot is
cave-horrors.png
(northwest from the entrance).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Buy 2300 sand (the goal is to get to level 70 crafting, each sand is approximately 88.1 xp) from the grinder (buy bucket packs as needed, e.g. at Alice’s farming shop near the ectofuntus). Superglass Make them into glass (18:3 no pickup). Blow all the glass into unpowered orbs doing artefacts, i.e. doing arteglass, to get to level 70 crafting. Do Pyramid Plunder for one (or two, it is recommended to get the second at/after level 91 thieving) sceptre(s) using the sceptre + xp method - all chests, sarcs in level 51+ rooms, urns in the level 81 room optional. Collect gold artefacts along the way - just bank them when your inv fills up, you’ll only need ~200 or so later.
Example setup for xp method pyramid plunder.
World hop to find a world with a North mummy room. The mummy resets every now and again, hop to find a new world.
On all but the last room do chest and sarc first then check the doors, ignore the urns. On the last room do urns first, then chest, then sarc, then leave.

If you haven’t already, it is worth making ~100 superantipoison potions (kill cows, for example at the crafting guild, to get cowhides, then use the Tower of Life to make unicows for noted unicorn horns, then make superantipoison potions). You can use a gravestone method to transfer the supplies required to the Tower of Life, though this requires a decent (28-42) initial supply of both hides and horns so it is probably not useful for just this step.
Use (super) energy potions and/or vile vigour for this. If you want to get full graceful first you could force spawn for it, though it’s not as good without the Ardougne elite diary.

metadata.items_needed: Superantipoison potions, any food

content.text: Train slayer to get to 100cb. Your target stats are 78 Attack, 85 Strength, 75(+) Defence and 72(+) prayer, which should probably give you 78(+)Hitpoints and ~75 Slayer around the time you hit 100cb.

Keep Strength around 10-15 levels ahead of Attack until it hits 83. At level 75 Attack make Arclight. Generally you only use accurate/aggressive/shared and get your bulk defence xp from defensive cast barrage tasks. Use piety whenever you’re using melee.
If you get an amulet of glory from dragon imps along the way use it for magic slayer tasks, not melee ones.
Unlock Broader Fletching. If you happen to get to a good slayer point situation, purchase the slayer helmet and complete the Desert Hard diary.

At level 90 magic you can use divine magic potions to stay at level 94 for entire (barrage) tasks and use ice barrage, if not you’ll have to use smoke barrage for ankou/dust devils and ice burst for dagannoths. Make sure to cast the spells on defensive.
Check out
20241231SlayerGuide
for advice on efficient slayer at this point.
If you (somehow) do not have runes for thralls or barrage, buy them.

Use your Pharaoh’s sceptre to teleport to the ancient magicks pyramid (Jaldraocht) to swap to the ancient spellbook when needed, and your POH Dark altar to swap to Arceuus when needed. When your sceptre is at 1 charge teleport to Pyramid Plunder (Jalsavrah) with 6 gold artefacts to recharge it to 25 charges.
At your own convenience, complete the quest While Guthix Sleeps along the way. Grab the 100 magic logs during the quest. Alternatively, postpone the quest until after the Corrupted Gauntlet.
Along the way you will hit milestones for the following diaries, complete them at your convenience along the way, putting all lamps on herblore:
At any point: save a shield left half (if you get one) for the Ardougne Hard diary
62 slayer - Kourend Hard diary
68 slayer - Wilderness Hard diary
72 slayer - Falador Hard diary
Slayer Helmet - Desert Hard diary

This also requires killing the Kalphite Queen. One of the more efficient ways to do this is by using thralls only, since this also completes the Combat Achievements task of only attacking with a Verac’s Flail. See
0 HP XP Kalphite Queen (Thralls) OSRS
or
OSRS 'Prayer Smasher' Elite Combat Achievement - Without Verac's Flail
for example kills. Keep in mind you need to
splash
all the grasp attacks.
100 combat level - Karamja Hard diary
After completing the Karamja Hard diary, mine gems in the underground gem mine, cut them in the bank, sell them for trading sticks at Gabooty (10 opal/10 jade/1 red topaz per world,
wear your Karamja gloves

) to get 100k trading sticks. In total this takes 520 cut opals, 520 cut jades and 52 red topazes (keep additional red topaz and a good amount of opals for slayer bracelets. Buy to a total of 10k karambwans at Tiadeche (using a Ring of Endurance, Vile Vigour and three client hopping for the best rates), banking with Rionasta’s parcel service. Video:
Shopscape Karambwans
. Do the Kourend & Kebos Hard diary (lamp on RC), then cook the karambwans at your convenience (1t cooking at the Hosidius range is best, cooking gauntlets do not work on karambwans).
If you previously bought bwans in Chapter 2, you won’t need as many now. Only buy the difference (or postpone it for later, if you wish).
Alternatively, use the (less macroefficient but faster)  Yazota/Brimhaven POH portal method for buying bwans
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDkz186YgME
) instead, which requires the fish barrel.
100 combat level - Western Provinces Diary (included for completeness, ignore this diary for now).
Along the way complete a long list of Combat Achievement diary tasks, exported to a separate document for readability.
20240131CombatAchievementPointReworkCA
shows a list of all tasks that can be included at or before this step.
CA's during Chapter 3 step 07

is an older document going into more detail on the slayer-related tasks (but note that some of these are no longer recommended!). If you are missing any of these tasks by the time you reach 100cb, go do them (stew boosting slayer as necessary). Collect the easy and medium Combat Achievement rewards, lamping herblore.
Complete His Faithful Servants along the way.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Buy broad arrowhead packs with most of your money (leave ~500k in reserve, buy the broad arrowtip packs at any slayer master, if you are opening fast enough the stock will slowly deplete. Hop worlds if the stock ever hits 700 or lower). Do Pest Control, veteran i.e. 100+ cb boat, for enough points for full elite void range (other two helmets optional) while fletching – 1250 points for just ranging, 1650 points for a full set, fletching during the games and only contributing as much as necessary to get points. You can optionally get the other two helmets as well, or ignore them(/consider getting them later).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Do the Fremennik Exiles, A Night at the Theatre (lamps on ranging), Hopespear’s Will. Start Monkey Madness II until you have access to Kruk’s Dungeon (with the Maniacal monkeys).
If you don’t have the fremennik shield yet, get it from Bardur with a ring of charos (a).

metadata.items_needed: tons and tons of items (these are linear quests so just follow the wiki)

content.text: Optional but recommended: with the Karamja Hard diary completed, 3t gem mine to level 97 mining (
gems route

), banking the uncut gems using the deposit box. With multiskill cutting the gems (see below) this is more efficient than 3t4g. This requires a charged amulet of glory! If you make one here you won’t have to make one next step.
You may skip this step if you don’t value multiskilling or efficiency enough to take such a long detour/don’t feel like it.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Go to Guardians of the Rift, participate in the minigame with the multiskilling method until you are completely out of uncut gems.
Guardians of the Rift - multiskilling

- this video shows a simple example of multiskill Guardians of the Rift - you still make combination runes, but focus on skilling rather than participating throughout most of the game (in fact, you only enter the west essence mine when it opens and ignore all other opportunities to collect essence).
The best way

to multiskill is by carrying a gem bag full with uncut gems (60 sapphires, emeralds, rubies and diamonds) into the minigame, taking them out of the gem sack, cutting them and depositing them at the Deposit Pool (which acts as a regular deposit box!) one inventory at a time. The point and xp rate will be lower than active GotR, but the crafting xp makes it more efficient.
Make an amulet of glory when you have the crafting level (75+5) to make one.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Catch 20k red chinchompas behind Prif or 16k black chinchompas (for 92 ranged, if you have extras then can consider throwing for more Ranged XP or using them for your first fire cape if you’re good at speed strats) in the wilderness. Throw the chins in the cave to get to 70 ranging, complete the Western Provinces Hard Diary (this involves getting one Zulrah kill), upgrade your void to Elite, (optionally: grab an offtask fire cape at some point along the way), return and throw the chins to get to level 92 ranging.
Make sure to use ranging potions and a bonecrusher (with at least 24k charges), your elite void ranged, an amulet of glory, shayzien boots 5, make a red d’hide shield (optional).
Use medium fuse.
Use protect melee and eagle eye, the regular potion drops will maintain your prayer (but bring a few to be safe, along with a teleport out).
If you die your chins will be lost
, so be careful and/or only bring a few thousand at a time.
Example setup for catching chins.
Example setup for throwing chins.
Make a blue d’hide shield (optional but recommended).
Example setup for Zulrah diary kill
, using blood barrage(/blitz).
https://streamable.com/l64fsw
example kill.
Red chinchompa calculator
for checking the numbers.
If you want to go for a lower ranged level
https://i.imgur.com/j291MJI.png

shows the max hits of the corrupted bow (t3 bow in the corrupted gauntlet) by level with eagle eye, levels 89 and 87 are reasonable alternative stopping points. This will make CG more difficult and slower and also reduce your max hits once you do get the bow though.

If you do not want to train with chinchompas (which are best by far) you could alternatively afk it in the nightmare zone. The nightmare zone has super ranging pots, making it the best afk ranged training method by far. The recommended afk range NMZ method is:
Wear (elite) void, a magic shortbow (i), rune arrows, amulet of glory, shayzien boots (5).
Use the Hawk Eye (10%) prayer, no overhead.

Rock cake(/DS2 orb) down to 1hp, use absorption potions, repeat this approximately every 6-9 minutes (it’s fine to go to higher health in between and lose more absorption charges, the goal is to have it afk. Some other guides will recommend resetting every minute or flicking rapid heal, this is a waste of time).
Use the super ranging potions (duh), resetting along with the rock cake + absorption pots + prayer pot sips (for hawk eye).
Use hard custom rumble (not standard!). Bitterkoekje’s
DPS Calculator
has a tab for NMZ DPS on set 1, so verify for yourself. Generally the recommended list of enemies is:
Moss Giant
Sand Snake
Count Draynor
King Roald
Witch’s Experiment (this choice might depend on level, use the DPS calculator to verify).

Optional and not recommended: you could detour for a zombie axe from armoured zombies at Zemouregal’s Fort (the higher level ones are better) with barrage spells, then use that along with a rune crossbow at the Royal Titans, specifically Eldric the Ice King, with the goal of unlocking the Deadeye prayer. This allows you to reduce the ranged level target from 92 to 89. Alternatively, you can knock out this scroll (and the other one) after CG, getting much faster kills.

metadata.items_needed: red/black chins, elite void ranged, ranging pots, glory, shayzien boots 5, red dragonhide shield optional.

content.text: Do Corrupted Gauntlet for 6 armour seeds and one enhanced weapon seed (~70 hours) (tip: use longrange on staff hits for defence xp - alternatively you can use accurate for ~0.5% more accuracy, but we think the def xp is more valuable). Maintain hourlies as usual. You should be level 93 ranging after this step. On average, this will also give the following loot:
2,960 crystal shards (it costs 2,300 shards to make a full set of crystal armour and a corrupted Bow of Faerdhinen
- train smithing as necessary using GP from CG, see step 17 below -

plus the armour needs charges). On droprate you will get another 580 shards (on top of the 2,800) from trading in excess armour and (regular) weapon seeds (into acorns, grown and chopped down for 14-16 shards each with ultracompost).

51.5m gp profit in gp and assorted alchs (500 battlestaves for which you need to charge orbs, 500 diamonds that need crafting first) - it is recommended to make diamond and ruby bracelets but only cut (and then ignore) lower tier gems.
Making ruby bracelets has an effective gp/hr rate of 9m, which is low enough you can consider ignoring them.
506k crafting xp from cutting and crafting gems and making air battlestaves.
10,6k cosmic runes, 6.9k nature runes, 6.4k law runes, 13.8k chaos runes (sell these for tokkul for future onyxes to make zenytes), 7.5k death runes, 6.3k blood runes
62.5k mithril arrows, 30.6k adamant arrows, 17.5k rune arrows, 3.8k dragon arrows

If you get 6 armour shards and an enhanced weapon seed way earlier, just leave and make up for the lack of gp and resources elsewhere. The Corrupted Gauntlet is only worth for the sake of grinding the Bow of Faerdhinen and its armour.
How to Farm the Corrupted Gauntlet | Lower your Average Time to 8 Minutes!

shows a good guide on completing the Corrupted Gauntlet with t1 prep. It is recommended to immediately aim for t1 armour, rather than first learning t2 armour methods and then unlearning those bad habits when settling into the grind later.
Important note: the food advice in this video guide is incorrect, the timing of eating does not matter (with some minor exceptions). It is highly recommended to
safe up
, i.e. eat
every time your HP is 21 or more below your max health
at Hunllef.
See also
OSRSRecklessLadHowDoesFoodWorkV2.png
McClumpy CG Prep

shows an easier approach to t1 prep including prescouting (it is highly recommended to prescout regardless of what else you choose to go for), sacrificing a bit of time per prep to gain lots of consistency.
Corrupted Gauntlet - prepping t1
shows a (lousy) example run by the author.

During the Hunllef fight focus on positioning > overheads > eating and drinking egniol > attacking > offensive prayers. In general you want to be near the middle of the room, so that Hunllef is standing between you and the edge of the room. This gives you maximum flexibility for moving around later.

metadata.items_needed: none (!!!)

content.text: Go to Guardians of the Rift, participate in the minigame until you have the full Raiments of the Eye and the colossal pouch.
Guardians of the Rift - multiskilling

- this video shows a simple example of multiskill Guardians of the Rift - you still make combination runes, but focus on skilling rather than participating throughout most of the game (in fact, you only enter the west essence mine when it opens and ignore all other opportunities to collect essence).
The best way

to multiskill is by carrying a gem bag full with uncut gems (60 sapphires, emeralds, rubies and diamonds) into the minigame, taking them out of the gem sack, cutting them and depositing them at the Deposit Pool (which acts as a regular deposit box!) one inventory at a time. The point and xp rate will be lower than active GotR, but the crafting xp makes it more efficient. If you are out of/low on uncut gems, instead do:
Guardians of the Rift - mass world, 4 pouches, combination runes
(the same method as before).
At 65 runecrafting complete the Ardougne Hard diary (also requires a shield left half).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Do While Guthix Sleeps if you haven’t already. Start and complete Dragon Slayer II (using your Bow of Faerdhinen to deal with the strong bosses – protect from magic and antifire potions will, when combined, provide decent dragonfire protection except against metal dragons and Galvek where you need the shield plus a rune crossbow), putting Ellen’s XP at the end on Strength. Kill Vorkath up to 50 times to get an Ava’s Assembler. Complete Monkey Madness II (put Duke’s xp on Strength).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Do Devious Minds, then Secrets of the North (a bowfa is pretty strong against, well, everything). Do Beneath Cursed Sands (did you know the bowfa works very well against these enemies) and Into the Tombs (don’t make me say it). The best use for the lamp is on strength. Optional but recommended: kill the Phantom Muspah(/Grumbler) for an ancient icon to upgrade your ancient staff (make some mithril sapphire bolts (e) and a rune crossbow for the smite phase). Start and complete Desert Treasure II, putting the xp on prayer. Collect a quest cape.
Your best weapons for the four bosses are:
Vardorvis: Dragon scimitar (this is going to be rough)
Duke Sucellus: Arclight
Leviathan: Bow of Faerdhinen
Whisperer: Charged god spells (just don’t stand in the wave bro)

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Use the money from CG to train smithing to level 86 with UIM gold. You’ll need to buy around 42.3k gold ores to get 86 Smithing for all diaries. Convert your cut diamonds and rubies into bracelets (optionally also enchant them, this is technically only worth it if you find a way to ‘0time’ it though) and charge enough unpowered orbs to match your battlestaves, then alch those/cash those in (e.g. at artefacts). Optional: also include ruby bracelets.
Optional: you can also train to ‘just’ level 83, so you can +5 for the Lumbridge Elite diary. This takes approximately 29.9k gold ores.

Optional: complete the Ardougne Elite Diary ‘make a rune crossbow from scratch’ step. If you have the rest of the stats complete the Ardougne Elite diary, this requires doing NMZ for imbuing a salve amulet.

Optional but recommended: force spawn some marks of grace, bankstanding processing resources you have (e.g. herbs) to make staminas to help with smithing. Using super energy potions is also fine, and the dropping method of UIM gold doesn’t require any at all.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Get a fire cape off task (if you don’t have one yet).
Note: there are many strategies for getting a fire cape. Some suggestions include:
Bring blood barrage to heal during the waves, carry your food to the Jad fight.
Bring vengeance and brews and deliberately tank a mage frog hit regularly to speed up the caves.
Bring thralls, recasting whenever you move to increase your dps (expensive but fast).
Bring spellbook swap, vengeance and thralls to combine 2+3.
You can find an example setup for the fight caves here.
If you have divine ranged potions, use those.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Get a dragon pickaxe (if you intend on going for at least partial completion of the Combat Achievements then just hop bosses while going for kc at each of them). If you plan on getting a Voidwaker later you will most likely get multiple dragon pickaxes along the way - the recommended bosses for that are Artio, Spindel and Vet’ion. Alternatively you may wish to postpone it for when you go for the Kq head, hoping to get one along the way.
This is a setup for fbow chaos elemental.
, this method is fast if you don’t care for the voidwaker.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Cash your banked herblore XP, using MOGs force spawning at Ardy. Make some staminas for future use.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IuqyCbHuxu8
(newest force spawning marks of grace example video).
Older sources:
Force spawning marks of grace on Ardy rooftop
and
Force Spawning Marks of Grace [Explanation + Example]
show the basics of force spawning marks of grace. However, we have since learned of the exact mechanics of spawning marks (
https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Mark_of_grace#Obtaining_marks_of_grace
), allowing for the best possible method below. The method is stunningly simple:
Every 3 to 9.5 minutes (inclusive, lower is better but don’t be too quick)
, do exactly one lap at Ardougne rooftops, then do other activities at your leisure. A mark of grace will spawn upon finishing the lap (and you will pick it up on your
next

lap) 75% of the time. When you are done, do one more lap (so a back to back lap to finish off) to grab the potential final mark. If no mark spawned on a certain lap don’t panic, just keep to the rhythm. Using this strategy you get a mark of grace per 1057.3 xp on average at Ardougne, so that going from level 98 to 99 with this method gives approximately 1160 marks of grace or 2900 (4)-dose staminas
(note: the real number is lower because of agility quest xp rewards collected after level 98)

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Complete the remaining tasks for the Falador and Kandarin Elite diaries if you have the herblore level required (boostable 81 and 86 respectively).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: 3s1g mine 30k sand (for level 93 crafting) or 80k sand (for level 99 crafting), buying all the sand (buy bucket packs first to match the amount required). Super glassmake all the sand with previously farmed giant seaweed. Arteglass blow molten glass into light orbs for crafting xp to 91 thieving (this won’t nearly use all your glass).
3s1g mining 80k sand will almost get you to level 99 mining, finish off 99 mining using whatever method you prefer.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Optional but recommended: now that you have daeyalt mining
https://streamable.com/it7kry

unlocked and the full raiments of the eye set, there is almost nothing holding you back from training runecrafting, e.g. with spellbook swap Vile Vigour fletching (multiskill) ZMI runecrafting (or non-spellbook swap stamina potions). It is macroefficient to complete level 95 runecrafting sooner rather than later, to have access to ample wrath runes for offering spells during slayer. Weave in the runecrafting grind at your own convenience, immediately is recommended. Blow glass while ZMI crafting, then when out of glass swap over to fletching instead (buy broad arrowhead packs and arrow shafts as needed).

It is meta to sell some of the runes you craft. Sell laws past the first 10,000 and nature runes past the first 30,000 (note: you may wish to keep more runes for your own purposes) to Ali Morissane. Optionally also sell chaos runes for tokkul to TzHaar-Mej-Roh, buying onyx bolt tips and uncut gems with the tokkul (this requires a fire cape).

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: If you only went for one sceptre earlier, do Pyramid Plunder for a second sceptre. Compared to last time the only things that changed are:

Use the teleport on your sceptre instead of entering the pyramid. You no longer need to hop for a North mummy. There is/was a bug where you have to leave the previous run instead of teleport out to avoid broken timers.
The rooms change little:

Room 7: loot the urns as you encounter them (south to north, then along the south wall around the chest). Open the doors clockwise starting east. If you're level 91 or above, make sure to go for chest when the timer hits around 2:10.
Room 8: grab the east urns first, then trace back south and go clockwise. Grab the chest before or after the last urn and exit through the northeast open door.

The most important trick to getting high xp and sceptre rates is not using the full 5 minutes per pp game - most of the time you should be getting laps of 4:40 or faster while opening all 81+ urns (and
skipping urns in the second to last room

if you can’t keep this pace). This also means you'll run out of synch with other people playing PP, so while you can make use of information from doors others have opened for you (and skip them) while in the same room it's not going to be huge most of the time.
Still open chests starting at level 51 room.

metadata.items_needed: tbd

content.text: Once you have enough mahogany planks from Misc (or chop teaks at your own convenience), train construction to level 83 with mahogany benches (or tables, slightly lower xp but also lower effort). This takes approximately 10.5k mahogany logs (47 days of Misc at 10 workers). Once done, build/upgrade the following:
Ornate rejuvenation pool (requires boostable 87 herblore, along with some Zulrah kills for the scales and antidote++)
Ornate jewellery box (if you have the dragonstones)
Gilded magic wardrobe (optional)
Fairy ring (purchase a second superior garden)
Marble cape rack
Occult altar
Mahogany treasure chest

The total item requirements for this are: 1 Pharaoh’s sceptre, 10000 astral runes, Ancient signet, Lunar signet, 5 limestone bricks, 5 buckets of water, 1000 soul runes, 1000 body runes, 10 stamina potions(4), 10 prayer potions(4), 3 marble blocks, 10 super restores(4), 9 gold leaves, 10 anti-venom(4), 1000 blood runes, 10 mushrooms, 1 Fairy enchantment, 4 mahogany planks, 5 combat bracelets(4), 5 skills necklaces(4), 8 Amulets of glory(4) and 8 Rings of wealth(5).
Note: this list assumes you didn’t have any pool previously built.

content.text: 3.3: Beyond BRUHsailer

This is the end of this guide. At this point your stats are high enough it is no longer important to do activities in any particular order, you can do them in whatever sequence you like without losing significant time. Below we include the following as suggestions:
20250309SlayerGuide
A Block/Skip/Do list for slayer tasks at several different slayer levels, intending to show macroefficient slayer progression.
An example of how to do every single slayer task that we recommend (location, method, gear etc).
20240131CombatAchievementPointReworkCA

Contains a guideline for when to complete Combat Achievement tasks, sorted by difficulty (but also by points). Following this document should let you complete the Elite tier of the Combat Achievements around the time you get to level 80 slayer, so that you gain full benefits of the increased superior rate for most of the slayer grind.
There are spare points compared to the required milestones, so feel free to skip a number of tasks you do not enjoy.
Ladlor's Interactive Progression Chart
